headline: What Next for U.S. Retail ETFs?
summary: Tariff disputes, weak consumer confidence and inflation worries weigh on U.S. retailers, with retail ETFs like XRT and ONLN remaining in focus.

raw.headline: What Next for U.S. Retail ETFs?
raw.summary: Tariff disputes, weak consumer confidence and inflation worries weigh on U.S. retailers, with retail ETFs like XRT and ONLN remaining in focus.

headline: Can TJX International Momentum Drive the Next Phase of Growth?
summary: TJX Companies builds on its global strength with rising comps, wider margins and plans for more than 1,800 new stores across key markets.

raw.headline: Can TJX International Momentum Drive the Next Phase of Growth?
raw.summary: TJX Companies builds on its global strength with rising comps, wider margins and plans for more than 1,800 new stores across key markets.

headline: RetailMeNot Launches App-Exclusive "5 to Buy" Savings Event: Weekly Cash Back on September's Top Five Shopping Categories
summary: Today, RetailMeNot, a leading savings and cash back destination, announces the launch of its "5 to Buy" September savings event - available only in the RetailMeNot app. Beginning Tuesday, September 2, and continuing every Tuesday of the month, shoppers can unlock one-day-only cash back exclusives of up to 30% across five of September's most in-demand shopping categories.

raw.headline: RetailMeNot Launches App-Exclusive "5 to Buy" Savings Event: Weekly Cash Back on September's Top Five Shopping Categories

headline: Uber Eats and Best Buy Team Up to Deliver Tech and Electronics Nationwide
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, September 02, 2025--Uber Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: UBER) today announced a new partnership with Best Buy that brings consumer electronics from more than 800 stores to the Uber Eats platform. Starting today, Best Buy customers can tap to order a wide range of electronics, appliances, and tech essentials on Uber Eats for delivery right to their doorsteps.

headline: Earnings live: Macy's beats estimates as turnaround continues; Dollar Tree falls despite outlook
summary: The gush of second quarter earnings reports is beginning to slow to a trickle, and with most of the reports in, the results have been mostly positive.
